name: Remove Protected In Title
author: Dejan Blazeski

sections.description:
Remove Protected In Title is a plugin that removes the prefix that wordpress adds on private and password protected pages.
Usage: Install and activate the plugin. Check one of your password protected or private pages to make sure everything works ok.
sections.installation:
Through wordpress admin:

  1. Go to Plugins -> Add New
  2. Search for “Remove Protected Title”
  3. Install the plugin
  4. Activate it

Through FTP:

  1. Download the plugin
  2. Unzip remove-protected-title.zip and upload the folder to the /wp-content/plugins/ directory
  3. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
sections.faq:
How to use?

After activation the plugin is loaded automatically. It will remove “Protected” and “Private” from all page titles on your site

short_description: This plugin removes the "Protected" or "Private" prefix that wordpress adds to Password protected / Private pages.
